titlestmt.titleproper: Morton, Jennie C. and Alice Orbison Frankfort, Kentucky album

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: Jennie C. Morton and Alice Orbison Frankfort, Kentucky album
did.abstract: The Jennie C. Morton and Alice Orbison Frankfort, Kentucky album (circa 1890s; 0.04 cubic feet, 1 box) is a late-nineteenth century scrapbook containing a collection of poems about Frankfort, Kentucky, written by Jennie C. Morton. Each poem is paired with an image of Frankfort scenes taken by Alice Orbison.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Jennie Morton, born 1838 in Franklin County, Kentucky, was regent and secretary treasurer of the Kentucky State Historical Society. She was an active member of the society as well as a poet. She died in 1920 of heart disease. Alice Orbison was born 1876 in Frankfort, Kentucky, and died 1959.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1997ms151: [identification of item], Jennie C. Morton and Alice Orbison Frankfort, Kentucky album, circa 1890s, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jennie C. Morton and Alice Orbison Frankfort, Kentucky album (circa 1890s, 0.04 cubic feet, 1 box) is a late-nineteenth century scrapbook containing a collection of poems about Frankfort, Kentucky, written by Jennie C. Morton. Each poem is paired with an image of Frankfort scenes taken by Alice Orbison. The poems are type written on paper bound together with yarn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
